alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 2:25PM PST until February 22 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Heavy snow in the Sierra tonight through Tuesday evening with low snow levels... .A cold weather system will bring moderate to heavy snow to the northern Sierra Nevada later this evening into Tuesday leading to significant travel impacts across the passes. Lowering snow levels on Tuesday may bring a dusting of snow down into the lower foothill elevations. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST TUESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Travel will be difficult. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches above 4000 feet, with 1 to 2 feet above 6000 feet, are expected. * WHERE...West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada including Interstate 80 over Donner Pass, Highway 50 over Echo Summit and Highway 88 over Carson Pass. * WHEN...4 PM today to 10 PM Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for reduced visibility at times, chain requirements and significant travel delays. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow means there will be snow covered roads and limited visibilities. Travel is not recommended while the warning is in effect. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
